tasks.title: [DB] Add unique constraint to User table for email
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Ensure each email address is unique within the system.

Technical Approach

  • Modify the User table schema to include a unique constraint on the email column.
  • Perform a database migration to apply the changes.

Definition of Done

  • Unique constraint is applied to the email column in the User table.
  • Database migration is successfully executed without errors.

tasks.title: [BE] Implement email and password authentication logic
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Authenticate users using their email and password.

Technical Approach

  • Develop an authentication endpoint in FastAPI.
  • Use Pydantic for request validation.
  • Implement logic to verify email and password against stored hash values.

Definition of Done

  • Authentication endpoint is functional and secure.
  • Users can log in using valid credentials.

tasks.title: [FE] Create login form with email and password fields
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Provide a user interface for users to input their email and password.

Technical Approach

  • Develop a login component in Next.js.
  • Use Zod for client-side validation of email and password fields.
  • Ensure password input is masked.

Definition of Done

  • Login form is implemented and styled according to design specifications.
  • Email and password fields are validated on the client side.

tasks.title: [Test] Write unit tests for email and password authentication
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Ensure the authentication logic works correctly and securely.

Technical Approach

  • Write unit tests for the authentication endpoint using pytest.
  • Test cases should cover successful login, invalid credentials, and non-existent email scenarios.

Definition of Done

  • All test cases are implemented and pass successfully.
  • Code coverage for authentication logic is above 90%.

tasks.title: [DB] Implement email format validation constraint
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Ensure email addresses stored in the database are in a valid format.

Technical Approach

  • Add a check constraint to the User table for email format validation.
  • Use a regular expression to define the valid email format.

Definition of Done

  • Email format constraint is applied to the User table.
  • Database migration is successfully executed without errors.

tasks.title: [BE] Implement email format validation in authentication logic
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Validate email format during the authentication process.

Technical Approach

  • Use Pydantic to enforce email format validation in the authentication request schema.
  • Return appropriate error messages for invalid email formats.

Definition of Done

  • Email format validation is enforced in the authentication logic.
  • Invalid email formats are rejected with clear error messages.

tasks.title: [FE] Implement client-side email format validation
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Ensure users enter a valid email format in the login form.

Technical Approach

  • Use Zod to validate the email format on the client side.
  • Provide real-time feedback to users for invalid email formats.

Definition of Done

  • Email format validation is implemented in the login form.
  • Users receive immediate feedback for invalid email formats.

tasks.title: [Test] Write tests for email format validation
tasks.description:
Objective

  • Ensure email format validation works correctly in both backend and frontend.

Technical Approach

  • Write unit tests for email format validation in the backend using pytest.
  • Write integration tests for client-side validation using Jest.

Definition of Done

  • All test cases for email format validation are implemented and pass successfully.
  • Code coverage for email validation logic is above 90%.
